topic.title: 2.2.2 Piping and Wiring Connection of Cutting Fluid Supply Unit

header.para: Piping and Wiring Connection of Cutting Fluid Supply Unit

list.style: text-indent:24px; margin-top:8px; margin-left:49px; line-height:1.18; font-family:Arial; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

li.text: Clean the area where the cutting fluid supply unit is being installed.
Push the Coolant tank [2] close to the Bed casting [6] rear.
Adjust the Levelling pad screw [8] and ensure Levelling pad [9] bottom butts the floor with minimum one turn of Jack [8] then tighten Hex nut [7].
Install the Rubber washer [11] and tighten Mounting screw [4] half turn to ensure minimum gap of 2mm between Cooling tank [5] and Bed casting [6]. If it is not, repeat step 3) to achieve this.
Ensure there no gap between Rubber exhaust [1] and Chip tray/Drum conveyor butting surface [5].
Connect each hose/pipe and wire according to the label.

para.style: text-align:center; line-height:1.18; page-break-before:always;
text-align:center; line-height:1.18;
text-align:center; margin-bottom:5px; line-height:1.18;
text-align:center; margin-bottom:8px;

para.text: Connect the piping and the wiring from the machine to the Coolant Tank as shown in
Piping and wiring inside of the Coolant Tank and machine are completed prior to shipment.
